newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Poll shows Colombians support euthanasia.
newsitem.headline: Poll shows Colombians support euthanasia.

text.p: A majority of Colombians would support a possible move by the country's Constitutional Court to decriminalize euthanasia, according to a poll published in Friday's editions of Bogota's El Espectador newspaper.

The poll, carried out in the country's four main cities, said 53 percent of Colombians agreed that no penalities should be imposed for the act of putting someone who is incurably ill and suffering intensely out of their misery.
Prison sentences of between six months and three years are currently imposed on anyone responsible for euthanasia in Colombia, a predominantly Roman Catholic country.
But the Constitutional Court is studying the possible decriminalization of the practice and is expected to issue a ruling next week.
The poll in El Espectador was carried out by the respected National Consulting Centre. The methodology of the survey was not included in the newspaper report, and neither was a margin for error.
